Clarification when Rpu1/ Rpu2/ R1/ R2 = Empty/ 0 Ω/ Short Pad
[1] Rpu1 or Rpu2 = Empty; The specific side of the trace related to Rpu1 = Empty or Rpu2 = Empty does not need a pull-up resistor to the 1.25V power rail (VCCPRIM_IO_OUT_SVID).
[2] R1 or R2 = 0 Ω/ Short Pad; The signal does not need a series resistor for the specific part on the trace which is being represented by R1 or R2.
Be aware, the trace still needs to remain connected end to end.
* It is strongly recommended to refer for the implementation on RVP.
Stuff VIDSOUT R1 with 0 Ω if VIDSOUT signal swing fails VIL with Gen5 VRTT tool.
Suggest having a GND stitching vias for each signal transition. The GND stitching vias to the signal vias need to be within 5.08 mm from one another.
Essential guidelines for routing near switching voltage regulator circuit

It is strongly recommended to meet routing near switching voltage regulator guidelines for SVID signals. Refer to "Switching VR Circuit Guideline" chapter in PDG for the details. (Technical White Paper Doc#: 726825)
When routing at minimum spacing route ALERT between DATA and CLK.
